title: Renault Nissan Automotive crosses 2.5 million vehicle production milestone - Autocar Professional
summary: The Renault Nissan Automotive plant in Chennai has reached a milestone of manufacturing 2.5 million cars and plans to introduce six new models, including two fully electric vehicles. The facility has also contributed significantly to India's automotive export market. Executives from Renault and Nissan emphasize their commitment to manufacturing excellence, innovative technologies, and future mobility solutions. A substantial investment of US$ 600 million has been announced to enhance production and R&D activities in India.
green_innovation: TRUE - The planned introduction of two fully electric vehicles reflects a commitment to reducing carbon emissions, aligning with environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE - The innovation involves the manufacturing of new models of cars, including fully electric vehicles, which are new improvements in the product line of the company.

green_process: TRUE - The article mentions the introduction of best-in-class manufacturing processes and the use of innovative technologies, suggesting a focus on reducing environmental impacts.
